meanings.definition: The quality or state of being literal.
meanings.sent1: Her writing lacked the literalnesses needed for the scientific report.
meanings.sent2: The literalnesses of his speech made it easy for everyone to understand.
meanings.sent3: The literalnesses of the robot's responses were both impressive and amusing.
meanings.sent4: His insistence on the literalnesses of the rules made him a difficult player to compete against.
meanings.sent5: The literalnesses of the instructions were so clear that even a child could follow them.

meanings.definition: The literal meaning or interpretation of something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained the literalnesses of the poem to the students.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the literalnesses of the text is crucial for accurate analysis.
meanings.sent3: The literalnesses of the joke were lost on the young audience.
meanings.sent4: She appreciated the literalnesses of the painting, finding beauty in its simplicity.
meanings.sent5: The literalnesses of the contract left no room for misinterpretation.
